rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
statement_text: The CDC announced on April 1 that a dairy farm worker in Texas had been been diagnosed with the H5N1 bird flu, marking only the second national case of the virus infecting a person.
The CDC announced on April 1 that a dairy farm worker in Texas had been been diagnosed with the H5N1 bird flu, marking only the second national case of the virus infecting a person.

rationale: 'had been diagnosed' and 'infecting' are plain outcome verbs. 'only the second national case' is a small quantity.
statement_text: The CDC announced on April 1 that a dairy farm worker in Texas had been been diagnosed with the H5N1 bird flu, marking only the second national case of the virus infecting a person.
The CDC announced on April 1 that a dairy farm worker in Texas had been been diagnosed with the H5N1 bird flu, marking only the second national case of the virus infecting a person.

rationale: Reports a human case, not calming.
statement_text: The CDC announced on April 1 that a dairy farm worker in Texas had been been diagnosed with the H5N1 bird flu, marking only the second national case of the virus infecting a person.

rationale: 'marking only the second national case' uses a minimiser ('only') with a scale contrast ('second national case').
statement_text: The CDC announced on April 1 that a dairy farm worker in Texas had been been diagnosed with the H5N1 bird flu, marking only the second national case of the virus infecting a person.
